page.title: 09St. Michael's church.
page.content: The idea of having a new modern church was the villagers.The new church was designed by Edward Edgecombe and was built in twelve months.The bricks for the church were burnt on the common land at Breadon Heath,and the slates came from Glyn Quarry,Denbigh.The newest vicar at Welshampton is Mr Durnell and he has been here for about two years.The new church was built in 1868,and called St.Michael's church. The average size of the congregation is now about 20,and there is a service held once every Sunday.Mr Durnell,the vicar,shares his time between 4 churches.The best attendance during the year is the Harvest Festival.The church wardens look after the building and the church yard.One is Mr Durnells warden,and the other is to represent the people.The P.C.C. is the people who run the church.
